Section_Desc: This section contains various functions related to environment manipulation, hidden properties, and game data retrieval, allowing access to both public and private objects and their properties within the game environment.

Funcs.Func_Description: Attempts to load chunk, returns a valid function if successful. If compilation fails, nil is returned alongside an error message.
Returns the identity for the current thread.
Returns the script from the given thread, even if the script has been set to nil. Cosmo threads will return nil.
Returns a hidden GUI container used to prevent detection from FindFirstChild. Does not trigger game.DescendantAdded.
Returns the Cosmo environment.
Returns the global game environment.
Returns the Lua registry.

Funcs.Func_Code: function getgc(include_tables: boolean): {[number]: function | userdata | {[any]: any}}
Funcs.Func_Description: Returns the garbage collection table. Optionally includes tables.
Returns the environment of the given script.
Returns all instances in the client.
Returns all instances that are parented to nil.
Returns a list of active connections to the specified signal.
Returns the hidden property of the object. Currently supports BinaryString, SharedString.
Returns an array of property names on the object.
Returns an array of hidden property names on the object.
Returns the Luau bytecode of the specified script.
Returns the hashed bytecode of the given script. Useful for detecting changes in game scripts.
Returns all loaded ModuleScripts. If filter is false, it will include core items.

Funcs.Func_Code: function getcustomasset(filename: string, preventcache: bool?): string
Funcs.Func_Description: Generates a custom content-id from the filename, allowing you to load content from the workspace folder. Optionally, prevent cache for reloading.
Gets the callback function of the specified callback on the given instance.
Returns the metatable value of obj, bypassing the __metatable field.
Sets the metatable of obj to mt.
Sets the read-only state of t to state, defining whether it can be written to or not.
Returns the read-only state of t.
Returns true if t is writable (not read-only).
Makes t writable by setting its read-only state to false.
Makes t read-only by setting its read-only state to true.

Funcs.Func_Code: function hookmetamethod(obj: (table | userdata), metamethod: string, replacement: function): function
Funcs.Func_Description: Hooks the given metamethod with a replacement function, returns the original function.

Funcs.Func_Code: function hookfunction(old: function, hook: function): function
Funcs.Func_Description: Hooks the specified function with the hook function and returns the original.

Section_Desc: Functions related to input manipulation, including mouse and keyboard input.

Funcs.Func_Description: Returns true if the main window is in focus. The main window must be focused for other input functions to work.
Performs a key press with the provided key.
Performs a key release with the provided key.
Stimulates a full left mouse click (press and release).
Stimulates a left mouse press (button is pressed but not released).
Stimulates a left mouse release (button is released after being pressed).
Stimulates a full right mouse click (press and release).
Stimulates a right mouse press (button is pressed but not released).
Stimulates a right mouse release (button is released after being pressed).

Section_Desc: Functions related to controlling console behavior, including printing and clearing console output.

Funcs.Func_Description: Prints the provided string to the console with the specified color, if provided.
Prints the provided string to the console.
Prints the provided string to the console with an 'Info' tag.
Prints the provided string to the console with a 'Warning' tag.
Prints the provided string to the console with an 'Error' tag.
Sets the title of the console window.
Clears all output from the console window.
